definitions: of or relating to the planet Mars or its hypothetical inhabitants
extremely strange or unfamiliar, as if from another planet entirely
examples: The Martian landscape appears red and barren
Scientists studied Martian soil samples from the rover
His martian approach to problem-solving baffled everyone
The technology seemed almost martian to the villagers

definitions: relating to or following the political and economic theories of Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels
examples: The Marxist interpretation of history focuses on class struggle
Several Marxist parties competed in the election

definitions: of or relating to Freemasons or their practices, beliefs, and organizations
examples: The masonic temple stood prominently downtown for centuries
He wore masonic symbols on his ceremonial apron

definitions: of or relating to Mauritania, its people, culture, or language
examples: Mauritanian cuisine combines Arab and African influences
The Mauritanian desert covers most of the country

definitions: of or relating to Mauritius, its people, culture, or languages
examples: Mauritian beaches attract tourists from around the world
The Mauritian economy depends heavily on tourism

definitions: of or relating to the Mediterranean Sea and the lands around it
having a climate characterized by hot dry summers and mild wet winters
examples: Mediterranean cultures share many culinary traditions
The Mediterranean coastline stretches for thousands of miles
California has a mediterranean climate perfect for wine
These plants thrive in mediterranean conditions

definitions: of or relating to Melanesia, its indigenous peoples, languages, or cultures
examples: Melanesian art features intricate wood carvings
The Melanesian islands include Fiji and Vanuatu

definitions: relating to or following the laws of inheritance discovered by Gregor Mendel
examples: Mendelian genetics explains how traits pass through generations
The disease follows a simple Mendelian pattern

definitions: containing or relating to the chemical element mercury
subject to sudden or unpredictable changes of mood or mind; volatile
examples: The old mercurial thermometer was replaced for safety
Mercurial compounds can be highly toxic
Her mercurial temperament made her difficult to work with
The stock market showed mercurial behavior this week

definitions: relating to the historical region and cultural area in the Americas before Spanish colonization
examples: Mesoamerican civilizations included the Maya and Aztec
The Mesoamerican calendar system was remarkably accurate

definitions: relating to the geological era between 252 and 66 million years ago
examples: Mesozoic fossils include many dinosaur species
The Mesozoic era ended with a mass extinction

definitions: relating to or denoting the Christian Protestant denomination originating from John Wesley
examples: The Methodist church emphasized personal faith and social justice
Methodist missionaries established schools across the region

definitions: of or relating to Mexico, its people, culture, or Spanish dialect
examples: Mexican cuisine is celebrated worldwide for its flavors
The Mexican peso fluctuated against the dollar

definitions: of or relating to Milan, its people, or their dialect of Italian
examples: Milanese fashion designers dominate the international runway
The Milanese risotto uses saffron for its golden color

definitions: relating to the Bronze Age civilization that flourished in Crete around 3000-1100 BCE
examples: Minoan frescoes depict dolphins and bull-leaping ceremonies
The Minoan palace at Knossos was remarkably sophisticated

definitions: relating to the present or recent times as opposed to the remote past
characterized by or using the most up-to-date techniques, ideas, or equipment
denoting the period of history from approximately 1500 CE to the present
examples: Modern medicine has eliminated many deadly diseases
The modern world faces unprecedented environmental challenges
Their modern approach revolutionized the entire industry
The building features modern architectural design throughout
Modern history begins with the Renaissance period
She studies modern European literature at university

definitions: relating to the Mongols or their language, culture, or historical empire
examples: Mongol warriors conquered vast territories under Genghis Khan
The Mongol empire was the largest contiguous land empire

definitions: of or relating to Mongolia, its people, language, or culture
examples: Mongolian nomads still practice traditional herding methods
The Mongolian steppe stretches endlessly across the horizon

definitions: relating to the Muslim inhabitants of northwest Africa and medieval Spain
denoting a style of architecture and decoration using horseshoe arches and intricate tilework
examples: Moorish influence shaped Spanish culture for centuries
The Moorish conquest changed the Iberian Peninsula
The palace features stunning Moorish architectural elements
Moorish designs incorporate geometric patterns and arabesques

definitions: relating to the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints or its members
examples: Mormon missionaries travel worldwide to share their faith
The Mormon tabernacle choir performs internationally acclaimed concerts

definitions: of or relating to Morocco, its people, culture, or Arabic dialect
examples: Moroccan markets offer vibrant spices and handcrafted goods
The Moroccan king plays a central constitutional role

definitions: denoting a picture or pattern produced by arranging small colored pieces of material
characterized by a combination of diverse elements forming a coherent whole
examples: The mosaic floor depicts scenes from ancient mythology
Byzantine churches feature elaborate mosaic decorations
America represents a mosaic society of different cultures
The forest creates a mosaic pattern of habitats

definitions: relating to Islam or its followers (older spelling variant of Muslim)
examples: Moslem traders established routes across the Sahara
The Moslem calendar follows lunar cycles

definitions: relating to Islam or its followers who worship Allah and follow Muhammad's teachings
examples: Muslim prayers occur five times throughout each day
The Muslim community celebrates Eid with great joy

definitions: of or relating to Namibia, its people, languages, or culture
examples: Namibian diamonds contribute significantly to the economy
The Namibian desert is one of the oldest

definitions: relating to Napoleon Bonaparte or his time as French emperor (1804-1815)
characterized by great ambition and an authoritarian approach like Napoleon
examples: The Napoleonic wars reshaped the map of Europe
Napoleonic code still influences legal systems today
His napoleonic ambitions alienated all his colleagues
She ruled with napoleonic authority over the department

definitions: relating to the National Socialist German Workers' Party under Adolf Hitler
characterized by extreme authoritarianism, racism, and brutal intolerance
examples: Nazi Germany committed horrific atrocities during World War II
The Nazi regime lasted from 1933 to 1945
His nazi tactics silenced all opposition voices
Such nazi behavior has no place in democracy

definitions: relating to an extinct species of human that lived in Eurasia
showing lack of intelligence or sophistication; extremely primitive or backward
examples: Neanderthal fossils reveal their advanced tool-making abilities
The Neanderthal genome shows interbreeding with modern humans
His neanderthal views on women belong in prehistory
Their neanderthal approach to conflict resolution failed

definitions: of or relating to Nepal, its people, languages, or culture
examples: Nepalese sherpas guide climbers up Mount Everest
The Nepalese rupee is the national currency

definitions: of or relating to Nepal, especially its official language or people
examples: Nepali language uses the Devanagari script for writing
The Nepali community celebrates many colorful festivals

definitions: produced, introduced, or discovered recently or now for the first time
not existing before; made, introduced, or discovered for the first time
not previously used or owned; fresh and unused condition
already existing but seen, experienced, or acquired recently for first time
examples: She bought a new car last week
The new restaurant opens tomorrow morning
Scientists discovered a new species of butterfly
This represents a new era in technology
These new shoes still smell like leather
He started his new job with enthusiasm
Meeting new people can be challenging sometimes
She's new to this type of work

definitions: relating to Sir Isaac Newton or his laws of motion and gravitation
examples: Newtonian mechanics accurately describes everyday physical phenomena
The Newtonian model breaks down at quantum scales

definitions: of or relating to Nicaragua, its people, culture, or Spanish dialect
examples: Nicaraguan coffee ranks among the world's finest
The Nicaraguan revolution changed the country's politics

definitions: of or relating to Nigeria, its people, languages, or culture
examples: Nigerian music influences pop culture worldwide today
The Nigerian economy is Africa's largest

definitions: relating to Scandinavia, Finland, and Iceland collectively
denoting a physical type of northern European peoples with tall stature and fair coloring
examples: Nordic countries consistently rank high in happiness surveys
The Nordic model combines capitalism with welfare
Her nordic features included blonde hair and blue eyes
The nordic skiing team dominated the Olympics

definitions: relating to the Normans who conquered England in 1066
denoting the Romanesque architecture introduced to England by the Normans
examples: The Norman conquest transformed English language and culture
Norman French became the language of nobility
The Norman cathedral displays massive stone pillars
Norman architecture features rounded arches and thick walls

definitions: relating to ancient or medieval Scandinavia, its peoples, or languages
examples: Norse mythology features gods like Thor and Odin
The Norse sagas tell epic tales of heroes

definitions: of or relating to Norway, its people, language, or culture
examples: Norwegian fjords attract millions of tourists annually
The Norwegian government manages vast oil reserves

definitions: having lived for a long time; no longer young
having existed for a long time; not recent or new
belonging to the past; former or previous in position
dating from the remote past; ancient or long-established
examples: The old man walked slowly with his cane
My grandmother is old but still very active
This old building needs extensive renovation work
They replaced the old system last year
She met her old teacher at the reunion
His old job paid much better
The old traditions still influence modern practices
Old civilizations left remarkable architectural monuments

definitions: relating to Mount Olympus or the twelve greater ancient Greek gods
superior in manner; majestic, aloof, or godlike in bearing
an athlete who competes or has competed in the Olympic Games
examples: The Olympian gods ruled from Mount Olympus
Zeus held olympian power over other deities
She maintained an olympian detachment from office politics
His olympian calm never wavered during crisis
The olympian athletes trained for years preparing
Former olympian champions coached the team

definitions: relating to the ancient or modern Olympic Games or their ideals
examples: Olympic records were broken in multiple events
The Olympic village houses thousands of athletes

definitions: conforming to what is generally accepted as right or true; established
following or conforming to traditional or generally accepted rules or beliefs
relating to the Orthodox Church with traditional Byzantine rite
examples: His orthodox interpretation follows established theological doctrine
The orthodox view dominated scientific thinking then
She takes an orthodox approach to treating patients
Their orthodox methods produced predictable results
The Orthodox church celebrates Easter using different calculations
Orthodox Christians follow ancient liturgical traditions

definitions: relating to the Turkish dynasty that ruled from 1300 to 1922
denoting a low upholstered seat without arms or back
examples: Ottoman architecture influenced building styles across three continents
The Ottoman Empire controlled vast territories
She put her feet up on the leather ottoman
The ottoman doubles as storage space

definitions: peaceful in character or intent; mild and gentle in nature
relating to the Pacific Ocean or regions around it
examples: His pacific nature made him an excellent mediator
They sought a pacific solution to the conflict
Pacific islands offer pristine beaches and coral reefs
The Pacific Rim economies continue growing rapidly

definitions: of or relating to Pakistan, its people, languages, or culture
examples: Pakistani cuisine features rich spices and flavors
The Pakistani rupee declined against major currencies

definitions: of or relating to Palestine, its Arab people, or their culture
examples: Palestinian territories include the West Bank and Gaza
The Palestinian authority governs certain designated areas

definitions: relating to ancient Persia or its people, language, or culture
relating to modern Iran, its people, or Farsi language
denoting a long-haired domestic cat breed originating from Iran
examples: Persian poetry influenced literature throughout the Islamic world
The Persian Empire stretched from India to Greece
Persian rugs are prized for intricate hand-woven patterns
She studies Persian language at the university
Their Persian cat requires daily grooming sessions
Persian cats have distinctive flat faces

definitions: of or relating to Peru, its people, languages, or culture
examples: Peruvian cuisine combines indigenous and Spanish influences
The Peruvian Amazon contains incredible biodiversity

definitions: relating to the pharaohs of ancient Egypt or their grand monumental style
examples: Pharaonic tombs contained treasures for the afterlife
The pharaonic period lasted over three thousand years

definitions: of or relating to the Philippines, its people, languages, or culture
examples: Philippine beaches rank among the world's most beautiful
The Philippine peso strengthened against the dollar
